dayplanner

Class DayPlanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • dayplanner.DayPlanner

  • public class DayPlanner
extends java.lang.Object
    DayPlanner class represents the Day Planner main program includes main method, carries major functions.

      • createActivity

        public static Activity createActivity()
        Takes in an activity type via string, creates a generic activity. Using a series of user input commands, takes in the required values to make a new activity.
        Returns:
        the newly created generic activity

      • searchActivity

        public static void searchActivity(java.util.ArrayList<Activity> toSearch)
        Searches through an array of generic activities. Passes in an activity array list to be searched. Asks the user to enter a start and end time, then keywords. Parses through array and finds matches
        Parameters:
        list - the list to be searched

      • createStartTime

        public static Time createStartTime()
        Used to initialize start times for activities, setting values for each attribute.
        Returns:
        the time created or null if troubles occurred when initializing.

      • createEndTime

        public static Time createEndTime()
        Used to initialize end times for activities, setting values for each attribute.
        Returns:
        the time created or null if troubles occurred when initializing.

      • createList

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Activity> createList(java.lang.String infile)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        createList used to take input from a file, parse through lines and create an array list based on the contents of the file.
        Parameters:
        infile - string that takes in the name of the input file for parsing
        Returns:
        the filled array list from the input file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeList

        public static void writeList(java.lang.String outfile,
             java.util.ArrayList<Activity> list)
        writeList Takes the array list of activities and writes each field line by line.
        Parameters:
        outfile - the name of the string used to write to file.
        list - the activity list used to get all required fields for the output file.
